doc:
Jennie Lee (American actress) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jennie_Lee_(American_actress) 0 Mary Jane Lee (September 4, 1848 – August 5, 1925), known as Jennie Lee, was an American stage actress and actress of the silent film era. Jennie Lee appeared in 58 films between 1912 and 1924, working especially in character parts under the directors John Ford and D. W. Griffith. She began her stage career at age nine and went on to support such actors as John Edward McCullough, Joseph Jefferson, Edwin Booth, and Helena Modjeska. She and her husband, actor William Courtright, appeared together in Griffith's Intolerance (1916). Incontestably, Lee's most famous portrayal was that of servant Mammy in The Birth of a Nation (1915), a role she played in blackface. Mary_Jane_Lee ( September_4_,_1848 – August_5_,_1925 ) , known as Jennie_Lee , was an_American_stage_actress_and_actress of the_silent_film_era . Jennie_Lee appeared in 58_films between 1912_and_1924 , working especially in character_parts under the_directors_John_Ford and D._W._Griffith . She began her_stage_career at age_nine and went on to_support such_actors as John_Edward_McCullough , Joseph_Jefferson , Edwin_Booth , and Helena_Modjeska . She and her_husband , actor_William_Courtright , appeared together in Griffith 's_Intolerance_(_1916_) . Incontestably , Lee 's most_famous portrayal was that of servant_Mammy in The_Birth of a_Nation_(_1915_) , a_role she played in blackface .
